episodeTitle: A Special Retrospective Before Marineford! The Three Navy Admirals Come Together!
episodeTitleJapanese: 海軍本部直前回想特別編 集結！三大将
episodeTitleRomanized: Kaigun Honbu Chokuzen Kaisou Supesharu - Shūketsu! San Taishō
description: As Luffy and his allies journey toward Marineford on a stolen Marine warship, the Marines prepare for Ace's execution and Whitebeard's inevitable attack. This special retrospective episode introduces the Three Admirals and the Shichibukai through flashbacks to their previous encounters with the Straw Hat Pirates, building anticipation for the coming war.

openingSong.title: Kaze wo Sagashite
openingSong.artist: Mari Yaguchi and the Straw Hats

events.title: Luffy's Group Approaches Marineford
events.description: Aboard the stolen Marine warship, Luffy, Jinbe, Buggy, and the other escaped Impel Down prisoners continue their journey toward Marineford. Buggy asks how much longer until they arrive and expresses his desire to bring down Marine Headquarters.
events.significance: Sets up the immediate context for the episode, showing Luffy's determination to reach Ace before the execution.

events.title: Admiral Aokiji Summoned for Battle
events.description: Admiral Aokiji (Kuzan) is awakened by a Marine officer and summoned to prepare for the coming war. The episode shows flashbacks to his previous encounter with the Straw Hat Pirates at Long Ring Long Land, where he demonstrated his ice abilities and nearly executed Nico Robin.
events.significance: Reintroduces one of the Three Admirals as a major threat and reminds viewers of his overwhelming power demonstrated against the Straw Hats.

events.title: Admiral Kizaru Called Without Lunch
events.description: Admiral Kizaru (Borsalino) is called in for duty without getting his lunch, maintaining his laid-back demeanor despite the impending war. Flashbacks show his devastating attack on the Straw Hat Pirates at Sabaody Archipelago, where Rayleigh intervened to save them.
events.significance: Highlights Kizaru's overwhelming power and his role in scattering the Straw Hat crew, establishing him as a formidable opponent for the coming war.

events.title: Admiral Akainu's Mysterious Introduction
events.description: The enigmatic Admiral Akainu (Sakazuki) stands before Fleet Admiral Sengoku in his office. Unlike the other admirals, Akainu receives no flashback sequences and remains a mysterious entity. He is shown as all business, concerned only with getting the job done and embodying 'Absolute Justice.'
events.significance: First significant appearance of Akainu, deliberately keeping him mysterious to build anticipation. His presence and demeanor establish him as perhaps the most dangerous of the three admirals.

events.title: The Three Admirals Assemble
events.description: All three Marine Admirals - Aokiji, Kizaru, and Akainu - are assembled and ready for the upcoming war at Marineford. Their combined presence represents the full might of the Marine forces preparing to face Whitebeard.
events.significance: Establishes the incredible defensive force waiting at Marineford, with three of the most powerful individuals in the One Piece world standing together.

events.title: Bartholomew Kuma Stands Ready
events.description: Shichibukai Bartholomew Kuma is shown among the forces assembling at Marineford. Flashbacks recall his encounters with the Straw Hat Pirates at Thriller Bark and Sabaody Archipelago, where he used his Paw-Paw Fruit powers to scatter the crew.
events.significance: Reminds viewers of Kuma's mysterious nature and his role in saving the Straw Hats despite being a government agent.

events.title: Dracule Mihawk Awaits Battle
events.description: The world's greatest swordsman, Dracule Mihawk, is shown at Marineford. Doflamingo comments that Mihawk wants to get his hands dirty. Flashbacks show Mihawk's fight with Zoro at the Baratie, where he defeated the young swordsman but spared him and encouraged him to grow stronger.
events.significance: Establishes Mihawk's presence at the war and reminds viewers of his incredible strength and his unique relationship with Zoro.

events.title: Gecko Moria Seeks Revenge
events.description: Gecko Moria is shown among the Shichibukai at Marineford, seeking to steal the shadows of Whitebeard's alliance. Flashbacks recall his defeat at the hands of Luffy's Third Gear during the Thriller Bark arc.
events.significance: Shows Moria's desire for revenge and his participation in the war effort, despite his previous defeat.

events.title: Boa Hancock's Conflicted Heart
events.description: Boa Hancock is summoned alongside Doflamingo. Flashbacks show her meeting with Luffy at Amazon Lily, where she fell in love with him after he defeated her sisters and showed kindness despite her cruelty. She hopes for Luffy's safety while being forced to participate in the war.
events.significance: Establishes Hancock's internal conflict between her duty as a Shichibukai and her love for Luffy, setting up her potential role in helping him.

events.title: Donquixote Doflamingo's Enigmatic Presence
events.description: Donquixote Doflamingo appears among the Shichibukai. Unlike the others, he has yet to meet Luffy's crew directly, making him an enigmatic wildcard in the coming conflict. The episode hints at his mysterious nature without revealing any backstory.
events.significance: Introduces Doflamingo as a major player at Marineford while maintaining his mysterious status, building anticipation for his future role.

themes.description: The episode focuses on both sides preparing for the inevitable clash at Marineford, building tension and anticipation for the coming battle.
themes.symbolism: The assembly of the Three Admirals and Shichibukai represents the full might of the World Government standing against the Whitebeard Pirates.

themes.description: The episode contrasts the Marines' concept of justice with Luffy's fight for his brother's freedom, setting up the ideological conflict at the heart of the Marineford War.
themes.symbolism: The Three Admirals each represent different interpretations of justice (Lazy, Unclear, and Absolute), while Luffy represents pure freedom and loyalty.

themes.description: The episode showcases the incredible power structures in the One Piece world through the display of the Admirals and Shichibukai.
themes.symbolism: The visual presentation of these powerful figures emphasizes the overwhelming force Luffy will face in trying to save Ace.

characterSpotlights.development: Reintroduced as one of the Three Admirals preparing for war. Flashbacks show his overwhelming power and complex sense of justice.
keyActions: Shown in flashbacks fighting the Straw Hats

characterSpotlights.development: Shown as laid-back but incredibly dangerous. Flashbacks remind viewers of his devastating attack on the Straw Hats at Sabaody.
keyActions: Maintains casual demeanor despite impending war

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as the most enigmatic and dangerous of the three admirals. Deliberately kept mysterious without flashback sequences.
Continues his desperate journey to Marineford to save Ace, undeterred by the massive forces assembling against him.
Torn between her duty to the World Government and her love for Luffy. Flashbacks show how she fell for him.

mangaDifferences.difference: This entire episode is anime-original recap content. It does not adapt any specific manga chapter but instead compiles flashbacks from previous story arcs to build anticipation for Marineford.

trivia.fact: This is the last episode to use 'Kaze wo Sagashite' as the opening theme. The song was performed by Mari Yaguchi and the Straw Hats and ran for 33 episodes (426-458).

sources.title: Kaze wo Sagashite - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Admiral Akainu is deliberately kept mysterious in this episode - unlike the other admirals and Shichibukai, he receives no flashback sequences, maintaining his enigmatic status.
This episode is approximately 90% flashback/recap content, making it one of the most recap-heavy episodes in the series at this point.
The episode achieved a 12.0% TV rating in Japan and ranked 3rd for its time slot.
The episode aired on July 11, 2010 in Japan, with the US simulcast airing one day earlier on July 10, 2010.
